items.title: crashes while using VST2 plugins v 1.7.0 + 1.7.1
items.body:
thank you for your work on the sparta vsts.  ive been using the plugins before the update to 1.7 a lot with no issues.  

after the update, most if not all the vst2s have been crashing my reaper and i had to revert back to 1.6.2.  i tried the 1.7.1 update and they still crash almost instantly, sometimes with a 30 sec delay

im using a 64 bit windows machine.  if you would like any more specifics please let me know.

items.title: Matrix Conv and Multi Conv Glitching
items.body:
I’m trying to implement matrix and multi Conv internal functions (the base functions used in the examples, not the examples themselves), but noticed that I get some glitching every so often. I notice this especially if I use a buffer size less than 512 samples.

Are there buffer size requirements to use these functions? Is there anything that comes to mind that could cause this glitching?

items.title: The automations are not recorded when the source is moved in the GUI
items.body:
Hello dear SPARTA developers.

I testet your plugins on Windows 10 x64 and 11 with Reaper ( and Ardour ). I like your plugin, because the sound quality is great.

But, on both systems, with the VST, VST3 and LV2 SPARTA Plugin, is the same issue.
The automations are not recorded when the source is moved in the Plugin-GUI. This seems to be a bug in the plugin and not in Reaper, because it behaves identically in Ardour. And other Plugins, f.e. IEM RoomEncoder are working fine.

I made a video of it and attached it.

SPARTA AmbiRoomSim ( doesn't work )
https://github.com/leomccormack/SPARTA/assets/150351395/7e1e45f4-d939-442d-90a9-c551400316c5

IEM RoomEncoder ( works perfectly )
https://github.com/leomccormack/SPARTA/assets/150351395/19e8ff64-95a0-47a9-8333-e424c1eee668

Is there a solution how to get the sparta plugins to work?

BR
Andreas

This problem seems to be exist since 2021.
https://github.com/leomccormack/SPARTA/issues/44

items.title: VST3 plugins don't detect channel counts over 64
items.body: In Reaper running on my Windows machine, the VST3 versions are not detecting the 128 channels Reaper is providing, but are still showing me the message that the channel count needs to be higher. 7. Order is working still fine and VST2 version also up to 10. Order.

items.title: Powermap, DirASS, and SLDoA plugins will crash on MacOS if a camera is selected while hosting the plugins on a "Runtime Hardened" DAW
items.body:
I don't see a way around this. If REAPER (or any other run-time hardened DAW) doesn't present the user with the option to enable it to have "Camera" access, then this crash is inevitable: 

> 2024-01-30 14:17:49.282736+0200 REAPER[2004:35811] [access] This app has crashed because it has a hardened runtime and attempted to access privacy-sensitive data without an entitlement indicating its intent to access this data.  The app must have the 'com.apple.security.device.camera' entitlement.

However, since an acoustic camera (see: [for example](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NoeEXCoriE4)) is quite a niche use case for an audio plugin, I think it would be unlikely that the REAPER devs would present this request to their users.

In previous versions of MacOS, the user could force/manually add permissions for an app to use the camera. However, as of 11.0+ it seems like this is no longer the case. 

Therefore, unless REAPER decides to request Camera access for these niche use cases, or Apple allows its users to decide these things for themselves, or we remove this feature from the plugins, then this crash is unavoidable. 

Unless someone has any other ideas?

items.title: Sparta Binuralizer crashes in adobe audition 2020.
items.body:
I have a bunch of old multichannel audio recordings I would like to try to listen to using some of the more modern stereo headphone spatializer techniques.

When I try loading the binuralizer plugin says Resampling the HRIR's.  Shows middling cpu activity on a few of my cores then eventually crashes.  This is pretty odd behavior for a VST plugin.

I thought it might be because I was trying to load it on 88kHz sample rate wav files, but I also tried it on 48Khz wav files to the same result.

Any idea if there is a fix, the entire program is essentially non responsive as soon as I load the plugin.

Also why not support higher sample rates?

items.title: SPARTA 6DoF conv: OSC and VST parameters, scene view, SOFA files
items.body:
These modifications are targeted to improve the "SPARTA 6DoF conv" plugin.
Main changes:
- OSC messages and parameters:
    - added missing items and bug fixes
- scene view:
    - X/Y axis swapped
    - refresh/repaint optimization
    - room grid improved
- SOFA files:
    - file loading/status displayed on the GUI
    - Added notification to host (using parameters output) about the room size when a sofa file is loaded or reloaded

items.title: Ubuntu 23.04 Carla doesn't detect plugins
items.body:
I followed the instructions from the readme and installed all optional apt packages.
Still, after adding all paths to Carla it doesn't show any SPARTA plugins

items.title: compass_tracker parameters not moving/updating in Ableton Live
items.body: I know Live isn't a recommended DAW for ambisonics, however it is possible to route multiple tracks into a multichannel VST plugin in Live. I have a project where I'd ideally like to control other device parameters in Live via input from an ambisonic mic (e.g. Azi/Elev parameters of tracked signals). I can get compass_tracker to run properly in Live via this track routing method, but the Target Azi/Elev parameters don't move in response to the tracked signal.

items.title: Sparta Plugins don't work on Macbook Pro M1 on Ventura - DAW Logic X Pro
items.body:
Hello, I have successfully downloaded your VST3 plugins for Mac Os Arm-x86, and the installation process went smoothly. 
All the plugins are in the correct folder, where all the other working plugins for Logic are also located. 
When I launch Logic X Pro, unlike when I install a new plugin, the window for scanning new plugins does not appear. 
It simply ignores them.
I've checked in the plugin manager, and your plugins do not appear at all.
I've tried forcing a reset of the audio unit and performing a complete rescan, but... nothing.
Just to clarify: it's not that the plugins are present in the plugin manager and marked as incompatible. 
They are simply not there.

Macbook Pro M1
macOS 13.5.1 
Logic 10.7.9

I'm very interested in trying out your plugins; can you help me figure this out?
Thanks in advance,
Paolo

items.title: Getting info out of Visualizers
items.body:
Hello,

I work at a college research institution and wanted to know if there is anyway to get data out of the visualizers? For instance, could we use DirASS, PowerMap, 6DoF, and Tracker and get the points out of the visualizer in some way, like OSC? We would like to record the visualizer's data. 

Is there any good way to do that or is this a feature that may be planned?

Thank you very much for your help and time!

items.title: Guide to use SPARTA Binauraliser system-wide on Windows
items.body:
Hi, and thank you for the amazing SPARTA plugins!

Here is the new tutorial:  https://youtu.be/VpaHXCwAtrE?t=728


This method relies on ASIO loopback and VSTHost. Not the fastest or easiest method, but it works :)
It would be even nicer if SPARTA plugins would work inside Equalizer APO (like ReaPlugs here: https://youtu.be/P26ff5ODRAc?t=170 ), but I am grateful it works as it is :)

items.title: 96khz Sample Rate Binauralizer?
items.body: Hi, I can see 44.1 or 48 support in the Binauralizer VST plugin code. Would it be possible to release a 96khz version? I would attempt to build it myself, but don't have the experience building VST or setup for development.

items.title: macOS Package Receipt
items.body:
Hi, @leomccormack 

We're looking to deploy SPARTA to some of our education customers. 

We have an issue where we can't deploy SPARTA without repackaging it. The tooling we use to automatically download and install (AutoPkg, Munki, Jamf Pro) needs a way to know that the version has been updated, and to install that latest version. One common way is looking at package receipts for this. 

Would it be possible for you to bump the package receipt version number when you release a new version so that they match? Currently the package receipt is on version 1.0 but the actual release number is 1.6.2 

` pkg-ref id="com.sparta.pkg." version="1.0" auth="Root"` would become  `pkg-ref id="com.sparta.pkg." version="1.6.2" auth="Root"`

Thanks for your consideration, and please let me know if you want any further clarification 

Paul

items.title: None of the plugins will load in Reaper (v.1.6.1 & 1.6.2 – macOS)
items.body: I've had problems with installing v.1.6.1 and just tried installing v.1.6.2 and get the same problem there: None of the plugins load in Reaper. Method to reproduce: - Start Reaper with a new empty project - Create a new track. (I also increased the number of channels on the track to 16) - Click the FX button - Within that window, click Add. From the list in the left panel, I chose `Developer > AALTO`, select all plugins listed and add them all. - Result: All of them have a similar error message to what is displayed above. Next, I tried to load the standalone application found in `/Applications/SPARTA/HOSIRR.app`. This resulted in a crash. I have uploaded the crash log here: https://gist.github.com/lossius/8a4de8ac73789969ca6bbb8798050434 MacBook Pro (q6 inch, 2019) 2,4 GHz 8-Core Intel Core i9 macOS Monterey 12.4 Reaper v6.61 - June 17 2022 Cleaning out all plugins named `sparta_XXX` in `/Library/Audio/Plugins/VST` and then re-installing v. 1.6.0 brings them all back to life. In all cases I have used the `(10.13+, x86-64) - (recommended for Intel CPUs)` installers.

items.title: 6DoFconv: fix tvconv_setTargetPosition() argument order
items.body:
hi,

the 6DoFconv plugin contains two calls to `tvconv_setTargetPosition()` with the `position` and `dim` arguments backwards, causing crashes and/or other incorrect behavior. this patch fixes that.

items.title: Binauralizer is silent
items.body:
Hi.

Thank you for the latest release with a fix for crashes on loading of certain SOFA files.

I have now tested latest Binauralizer on 2 different Windows computers with 2 different hosts and must conclude that: **every time I load a custom HRIR SOFA file there is no sound out of Binauralizer**. These are the [same HRTFs](https://github.com/leomccormack/SPARTA/files/8669881/HRIR_ARI_48000.zip) which previously tended to crash the VST. Now they load nicely, I can see that HRIR is loaded, only no sound comes out.  The default HRTF still works, only the custom SOFA HRIR is silent.


Also minor thing:  the version number on the plugin says "Build Data April 3 2022" which is most likely wrong. 

Best regards,
Sergejs

items.title: Look into re-enabling dipole option for Array2SH
items.body: The issue before was that if the user had e.g. a spherical microphone array of cardioid/omni sensors, but set this option to "dipole" out of curiosity, the output gain was significantly/dangerously higher. Perhaps a hard coded -12dB would address this though.

items.title: No sound at AmbDec output (WIN10/REAPER)
items.body:
Hello,

First thank you for the latest release, it solve many issues ! But I'm facing a strange one here.
On one of my windows machine I can't get any sound at the output of AmbDEC. Everything seems to be properly install, but at admit I don't have much idea on how to fix that. Maybe there's a dependancy I don't have ?

What is strange is that it work perfectly on an other computer running Windows 11 and REAPER latest version. The problematic machine runs Windows 10 and REAPER too. Both OS are up to date.

Let me know if you need any more information !
Thanks

Some of the sparta VSTs always crashed when I uploaded my own HRTF. However, it works well when I use the default HRTF.
I will be appreciate that you could help me to chekck it out what is the thing that makes the failure.
I made my HRTF based on mesh2hrtf.[https://sourceforge.net/p/mesh2hrtf/wiki/Tutorials/](url)  I believe I am not the only one with this problem.
And this is the sofa file.
 [HRIR_ARI_48000.zip](https://github.com/leomccormack/SPARTA/files/8669881/HRIR_ARI_48000.zip)
Looking forward to hear from you.
BR,
Wenkang

items.body:

I'v both tried with SPARTA plugins version 1.5.2 and 1.5.1.

I'm on a MacBook Pro (13inch mid 2010) with HighSierra installed on it (10.13.4).

How can I solve?
I've tried to copy and paste here the error log I've saved but the text is too long (>65536 characters). How can I share it to you?
Thank you so much for your support
